about_the_game:
XPlayer is a Windows video player that allows you to mark highlights in your videos for easy future access.

Steps

1 Add a video folder. XPlayer will calculate the hash of each video file. This will take some time to ensure that the files can be correctly identified after being moved or renamed.
2 Use the cut function to cut out the highlights and add as many tags as you want. When all the clips of the video have tags, the video will show the completion mark.
3 Switch to playback mode. Now you can watch the video by tag, or use the export function to export all the currently opened video clips as a video file.

Features

  • Native WPF application.
  • MVVM, edit mode and playback mode are the same data but different interfaces, switching without delay.
  • Supports multiple export tasks to be performed simultaneously in the background, automatically using hardware acceleration.
